meanings.definition: Speech sounds produced without occluding the vocal tract.
meanings.sent1: In the word 'apple,' the letter 'a' represents one of the vowels.
meanings.sent2: She sang a beautiful melody with clear vowels.
meanings.sent3: The vowels in the choir's song harmonized perfectly.
meanings.sent4: The vowels of the wind whispered through the trees.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of vowels in pronunciation.

meanings.definition: Letters representing speech sounds produced without occluding the vocal tract.
meanings.sent1: The alphabet has five vowels: a, e, i, o, and u.
meanings.sent2: When writing, make sure to include all the vowels in your words.
meanings.sent3: The vowels on the page danced around in colorful patterns.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like vowels in a song, flowing smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The vowels stood out boldly in the sea of consonants.
